meanings.definition: Surrounded or enclosed by a border or edging.
meanings.sent1: The embordered picture frame added a nice touch to the room.
meanings.sent2: The embordered garden path looked neat and well-defined.
meanings.sent3: The embordered cake was almost too pretty to eat.
meanings.sent4: Her embordered dress made her stand out in the crowd.
meanings.sent5: The embordered quilt was a work of art.

meanings.definition: To provide with a border or edging.
meanings.sent1: She carefully embordered the tablecloth with lace trim.
meanings.sent2: The artist embordered the painting with a gold frame.
meanings.sent3: He embordered the sidewalk with colorful chalk drawings.
meanings.sent4: The river embordered the town, creating a natural boundary.
meanings.sent5: The tailor embordered the dress with intricate stitching.

meanings.definition: To be surrounded or enclosed by a border or edging.
meanings.sent1: The garden embordered by a white picket fence looked charming.
meanings.sent2: The house embordered by tall trees felt secluded and peaceful.
meanings.sent3: The cake embordered by fresh flowers was a delightful centerpiece.
meanings.sent4: Her face embordered by curly hair framed her bright smile.
meanings.sent5: The park embordered by a river was a serene retreat.
